metadata.title: USN-5062-1 -- Linux kernel vulnerability
metadata.description: Maxim Levitsky discovered that the KVM hypervisor implementation for AMD processors in the Linux kernel did not properly prevent a guest VM from enabling AVIC in nested guest VMs. An attacker in a guest VM could use this to write to portions of the host's physical memory.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-5062-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  linux-aws-tools-4.4.0-1096 - 4.4.0-1096.101 linux-cloud-tools-4.4.0-1096-aws - 4.4.0-1096.101 linux-tools-4.4.0-1096-aws -
